intro: Oxydectes timandroides, commonly known as the Timan Desert orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that bloom during the brief rainy season. The plant's leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal moisture, making it highly resilient to drought. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oxydectes timandroides is considered a vulnerable species.
